item.title: Android Javascript Debugging
item.description: As a web developer, I have to use console.log a lot to see what’s going on with Javascript in my web applications, and Android Browser does not make this an easy task. Initial searches brought up articles suggesting use of the Android SDK, plugging my phone into my computer, setting up the debug bridge, et cetera. That’s a lot of work. There is a way to do Javascript debugging entirely on your phone without the Android SDK.

item.title: Server vs Client
item.description: My presumption is that it’s because of the passionate advent of JQuery, that there has been an increasing rise of using Javascript, in precedence of a server side language like PHP or Ruby. This circumstance is arguably the sole cause to how and why, mostly designers, are simply not learning a better way. I’m here to enlighten you.
